column4: I'm having trouble installing Ubutnu, anyone got a sec to help?
what sort of trouble?
I can't get the partitions right, I get the error "No root file system defined"
yes.  whichever partition you'd like to install Ubuntu to, set that partition to have mount point / .  Understand?
I have done that and I still get the error
could you post a screenshot?
Post it to where?
http://imageshack.us/
That begs the greater question, how do I take a screenshot from the live CD?
print-screen button
I tried that, nothing happens when I try to paste it into GIMP
why are you using GIMP?  print-screen will produce a file while you will upload to imageshack.
When I hit Print Screen nothing seems to happen
try the GNOME menu.  Applications > Accessories > Screen Shot, I think.
okay, registering an account with the screenshot now
http://img142.imageshack.us/img142/9369/screenshoteu7.png
:)  you've got a period after the forward slash.  get rid of the period.
You might just be my hero
Welcome to Ubuntu.  :)  haha
it is installing, looks OK so far, thanks so much!
no problem.  let us know if anything is unclear.
anyway to reclaim that unused 6GB and the weird 1GB partition? I have XP on the 50GB one, but not sure what the others are
if you're unsure, sda3 may be associated with Windows somehow, so don't nuke it til you know.  the unusable is a mystery to me.
Originally it was part of the 8GB "restore" partition on my HP laptop, but I resized it down to a 2GB SWAP and it made the other 6GB unusable, not sure at all about the random 1GB
